TF030667-JAPAN CTF - FY05 GENERAL: LAC
            (ALL COUNTRIES IN LATIN AMERICA AND THE C,TF053765-PHRD-EL SALVADOR: SOCIAL

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Social Protection
            Project for El Salvador were as follows: the Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and the Borrower performance
            was moderately satisfactory, all other ratings are not
            applicable since the operation is cancelled.  The
            Bank's Board approved the loan on October 27, 2005 but
            it was not signed or made effective within 18 months of
            Board approval. The Bank team had appropriately identified
            political polarization as a source of risk for the loan to
            be ratified and deployed all possible mitigation actions;
            while the political environment at the time of Country
            Assistance Strategy (CAS) and loan processing provided
            evidence suggesting that this risk was manageable. Some
            lessons learned are in the areas of: growing political
            polarization regarding the role of multilateral development
            banks in Latin America, (ii) redefining Bank cooperation
            strategies (in addition to loan financing), management of
            project exogenous issues, and (iv) the important role of
            information and outreach in Bank's work.
